headline: Could This Bear Market Buy Help You Become a Millionaire?
summary: The stock has fallen dramatically, and it now offers a very attractive dividend yield.  Try PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP), whose stock price has fallen roughly 30% from its 2023 peak at the time of this writing.  One of the first things to like about PepsiCo is its core business, which is selling food.

headline: Lay's, Tostitos Comeback Set To Ignite Q4, But Can PepsiCo Fend Off Q3 Earnings Dip?
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) is making bold operational shifts across its global portfolio as it navigates shifting demand patterns and prepares for key product relaunches. These moves come as the company looks to balance short-term pressures with long-term growth, especially in its North American and international markets. Bank of America Securities analyst Peter T. Galbo reiterated the Neutral rating on PepsiCo, raising the price forecast from $145 to $150. Also Read: PepsiCo’s $2 Billion Health

headline: PepsiCo (PEP) Q2 Earnings Drop: Net Income Falls to US$1,263 Million
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) recently announced its earnings on July 17, 2025, reporting a decline in net income, though there was a slight uptick in sales growth. This occurred amidst an ongoing share buyback program, signifying the company's intent to return value to its investors. Despite mixed economic indicators and a market setting new records, the company's strategic collaborations and product launches provided additional focus areas, though they may have only added weight to broader market trends...

headline: S&P Futures Gain as Strong U.S. Economic Data and Earnings Boost Optimism
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are trending up +0.19% this morning, extending yesterday’s gains as rising confidence in the strength of the U.S. economy and positive earnings reports bolstered investors’ risk appetite.

headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Independent Regime Change
summary: The Federal Reserve debate continued. Former Fed governor Kevin Warsh, a potential nominee to succeed Chair Jerome Powell, said the central bank should stay independent. But he also said President Trump “is right to be pushing the Fed publicly,” and “we need regime change in the conduct of policy.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Independent Regime Change

headline: PEP Q1 Deep Dive: Consumer Headwinds and Tariffs Challenge Growth, International Remains Key
summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $22.73 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.12 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: PEP Q1 Deep Dive: Consumer Headwinds and Tariffs Challenge Growth, International Remains Key

headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We Find Risky
summary: A company that generates cash isn’t automatically a winner. Some businesses stockpile cash but fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their ability to expand.
